title: Eldorado Buying Caesars for $8.6 Billion, Looking at Large Cap Stocks, The History of Trade Piracy
itunes:title: Eldorado Buying Caesars for $8.6 Billion, Looking at Large Cap Stocks, The History of Trade Piracy
description:
Bloomberg News L.A. Bureau Chief Chris Palmeri and Bloomberg Opinion Deals Columnist Tara Lachapelle discuss Eldorado Resorts buying Caesars Entertainment for about $8.58 billion in a deal backed by activist billionaire Carl Icahn that will create the largest U.S. gaming operator. Norm Conley, CEO at JAG Capital Management, talks about investing in large cap names. Andy Browne, Bloomberg New Economy Editorial Director, explains how U.S. history shows that China’s current trade position does not make them a uniquely bad actor. Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Bloomberg News Legal Reporter David Voreacos discuss the story of a polygamist accused of scamming the U.S. out of $500 million. And we Drive to the Close with Daryl Deke, CEO at Newmarket Wealth Management.

Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly.  Producer: Paul Brennan
